intro: Oldenlandia pulvinata, commonly known as the purple spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and typically grows as a herbaceous perennial or annual. The plant features slender, erect stems and produces small, showy flowers in shades of purple or blue. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often have a hairy texture. The flowers are typically clustered in racemes and bloom throughout the warm seasons.
